Here are some examples of diagrams build with DiagrammeR:

```{r knitr-steup, echo = FALSE}

knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  comment = "#>",
  collapse = TRUE,
  message = FALSE,
  warning = FALSE,
  cache = TRUE,
  out.width = "70%",
  fig.align = 'center',
  fig.width = 6,
  fig.asp =   1,
  fig.show = "hold",
  size = "tiny"
)
```


```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(DiagrammeR)
```



```{r eval = TRUE}
grViz("
digraph boxes_and_circles {
      graph [layout = circo,
             overlap = true]

      node [shape = circle,
            fixedsize = true,
            fontname = Helvetica,
            width = 1]
      Problem; Plan; Data; Analysis; Conclusion
      

      edge [color = grey]      
      Problem -> Plan
      Plan -> Data
      Data -> Analysis
      Analysis -> Conclusion
      Conclusion -> Problem
      }
      ")
```



<!-- ![](/post/2018-11-07-simple-examples-with-diagrammer_files/diagrammer1.png) -->

This diagram is inspired by Figure 1 from the paper of [Wild and Pfannkuch, 1999](https://www.stat.auckland.ac.nz/~iase/publications/isr/99.Wild.Pfannkuch.pdf).
